name: MEAN stack deployment
description: MEAN - A simple and scalable starting point for full stack JavaScript web development.

metadata.longDescription: Deploys a MEAN stack (Mongo, Express, Angular, Node) in VMware providing a complete development environment. This deployment also deploys a simple sample application to validate the stack is operational.

bullets.title: Topology
bullets.description:
VMware: 2 virtual machines:
  • - Node.js, Angular.js, Express.js;
  • - MongoDB

bullets.title: Software deployed
bullets.description:
1. MongoDB:a NoSQL database
2. Express.js:a web application framework that runs on Node.js
3. Angular.js:a JavaScript MVC framework that runs in browser JavaScript engines
4. Node.js:an execution environment for event-driven server-side and networking applications

bullets.title: Default virtual machine settings
bullets.description:
• VMware:
    • Flavor:
      • MongoDB:
        • Cores - 1
        • Memory - 1GB
        • Storage - Depends on Image
      • Front end:
        • Cores - 2
        • Memory - 4GB
        • Storage - Depends on Image
    • Network:
      • Private IP:
        • Availability - Customer Provided
        • Ingress - Via VPN
        • Egress - Allows HTTP to all destinations
      • Public IP:
        • Availability - None
    • Firewall:
      • MongoDB:
        • Ingress - Allows SSH, and TCP 27017 from all sources
        • Egress - All
      • Front end:
        • Ingress - Allows SSH, and TCP 8443 from all sources
        • Egress - All

bullets.title: Usage and special notes
bullets.description:
• 1. Downloads latest releases of software.
  • 2. To access the application and virtual machines, please see the instructions in the output log.
  • 3. The sample application in this deployment is from the open source project https://github.com/meanjs/mean and more details can be found in http://mean.io/.
